item.title: Fortnite: How to Get the Free First Order Stormtrooper Skin
item.description:
Fortnite celebrated May the Fourth in style this year. The Star Wars franchise got an entire mini-season dedicated to it for the year of 2025. The event featured an array of skins, which could be obtained in the Item Shop and by purchasing the Battle Pass and the LEGO Pass. However, that's not all. Players could also get the First Order Stormtrooper for free as part of a limited-time offer.

The offer was supposed to expire on August 31, 2025, but Epic Games decided to extend it by two months, giving players some extra time to claim it. This guide shows players how they can get the First Order Stormtrooper for free in Fortnite before the offer runs out once again and they have to purchase it with V-Bucks.

How to Get the Free First Order Stormtrooper Skin in Fortnite

To promote May the Fourth, Epic Games hosted the Galactic Battle season in Fortnite . Since then, the First Order Stormtrooper skin has been available for free. To get the free Star Wars skin in Fortnite , players need to connect their Epic Games account with a MyDisney account. It is that simple. If they don't have a MyDisney account, then all they need to do is create one and link it.

Once they've done this, the next time that they log into Fortnite , they will be greeted with the free First Order Stormtrooper skin . Here is how the First Order Stormtrooper skin and its LEGO variant look in Fortnite :

How to Connect Epic Games to MyDisney

As mentioned above, players must connect their Epic Games account to a MyDisney account in order to get the First Order Stormtrooper skin for free in Fortnite .

To connect an Epic Games account with a MyDisney account, players must log into the Epic Games website, click on their username in the top right corner of the screen, and select Account. Next, they must select the Apps & Accounts tab and then Connect below the MyDisney logo .

Here, they'll have to either log into their MyDisney account or create a new one, which only requires an email, a date of birth, and a password. Once they've connected the accounts, the skin will appear in their in-game locker the next time players log into Fortnite .

This remains a limited-time offer. Gamers have until October 31, 2025, to connect their Epic Games and MyDisney accounts in order to receive the First Order Stormtrooper skin for free in Fortnite . However, since skins are not exclusive in Fortnite , it may return to the Item Shop at a later date.

item.title: Rumor: Metroid Prime 4 Release Date Leaked
item.description:
According to the latest rumors, it seems as though the Metroid Prime 4: Beyond release date may potentially be Thursday, September 18. Metroid Prime 4 was one of the first games ever announced for the original Switch, unveiled all the way back in the summer of 2017. A couple of years later, Nintendo made the shock announcement that it had decided to reboot development on the game, with original Metroid Prime trilogy developer Retro Studios taking over for Bandai Namco.

After it was announced that Metroid Prime 4 development was being restarted, news on the game was hard to come by. All fans had to go on at that point was a work-in-progress logo and little else until 2024, when Nintendo finally released the first full-blown trailer for the game, revealing gameplay, story details, and its Beyond subtitle. A release date for Metroid Prime 4: Beyond still has not been announced in an official capacity at the time of this writing, but if the latest rumor is to be believed, fans could be playing the game in a matter of weeks.

Metroid Prime 4 Rumored Release Date

Metroid fans should take this with a massive grain of salt, but Reddit user SHoulderAdvanced6854 pointed out how Russian retailer Videoigr had listed a September 18 release date for Metroid Prime 4 . If this release date is accurate, it would mean a super quick turnaround from when the game's release date is announced and when it drops. Leaks have suggested that Nintendo is hosting a Nintendo Direct in September to showcase upcoming games, Metroid Prime 4: Beyond included, and so one would imagine its release date would be announced at such a show.

Fans should keep their expectations in check before getting too excited about the potential September 18 release date for Metroid Prime 4: Beyond , but it's not outside the realm of possibility. After all, Nintendo shadow dropped Metroid Prime Remastered a couple of years ago, and earlier this summer, some advertising for the game mistakenly stated it was "out now." It's possible Metroid Prime 4 is going to be shadow dropped as well, but it's also possible that there will be some time between the September 2025 Nintendo Direct and the game's release date.

Something that makes this rumor a little easier to believe is the fact that Nintendo doesn't have anything major lined up for September 2025 at the time of this writing. Nintendo likes to keep a cadence of about one exclusive release per month, give or take, and it seems like it would be a huge missed opportunity to skip September. October is already taken by Pokemon Legends: Z-A , while Kirby Air Riders is scheduled to launch in November. Perhaps Nintendo is looking to drop Metroid Prime 4: Beyond in December instead of September, but that remains to be seen. Regardless, it will be interesting to see what happens with the Metroid Prime 4 release date and if the leak is accurate.

item.title: Monopoly GO: How to Get Cookin’ Dice Skin
item.description:
With the launch of the Bon Appétit album, Monopoly GO is dishing out a tasty lineup of food-themed collectibles. This season introduces fresh sticker sets, exclusive rewards, and limited-time collectibles that all fit the foodie theme. One of the standout additions is the brand-new Cookin’ Dice skin . This sizzling cosmetic upgrade transforms your boring dice into a more playful, kitchen-inspired design. Read on to learn how you can add the Cookin’ Dice Skin to your Monopoly GO shelves.

How to Get Cookin’ Dice Skin in Monopoly GO

The Cookin’ Dice Skin is a chef-inspired cosmetic that perfectly matches the Bon Appétit album’s food-filled theme. To earn it, you’ll need to complete the Prestige version of the Bon Appétit album.

This means finishing all 19 standard sticker sets first. Once those are completed, the album unlocks 2 more Prestige sets, raising the total to 21 sets . Completing both the standard and Prestige sets essentially means completing the album twice.

Completing the Bon Appétit album will take some strategy, patience, and luck, but the reward is worth it. Once you’ve wrapped up both the standard and Prestige sets, you’ll secure the limited-time Cookin’ Dice Skin. Along with this exclusive dice skin, you’ll also receive 15,000 Dice Rolls and a generous amount of cash.

All Sticker Sets in Bon Appétit Album

Here’s a full list of all 19 standard sets and 2 Prestige sets in the Bon Appetit album that you need to complete for the Cookin’ Dice Skin:

item.title: Fortnite Extends Free Skin Offer
item.description:
The First Order Stormtrooper skin will remain available in Fortnite for an additional two months following a recent date extension. Between Chapter 6 Season 2 and Chapter 6 Season 3, Fortnite held a mini-season dedicated to Star Wars . This was around the time of the annual May the Fourth in-game event, and Epic Games decided to take it up a notch. The Battle Royale island was overrun with characters from the Star Wars franchise, POIs were replaced with known locations from the series, lightsabers became everyone's go-to weapon, and starships could be found and flown all around the area.

The Fortnite mini-season, titled Galactic Battle, brought themed content across various game modes. The First Order LEGO Pass included Captain Phasma as its main reward. The Galactic Battle Pass featured the Wookie Cuddle Team Leader, which was a remixed version of Cuddle Team Leader, a classic Fortnite skin, as well as well-known characters, such as Poe Dameron, Emperor Palpatine, and General Grievous.

Fortnite First Order Stormtrooper Skin Offer Extended Until October 31, 2025

However, these weren't the only Star Wars skins added to Fortnite for the Galactic Battle event. The First Order Stormtrooper skin was given away at the time for free as part of a promotional offer. The deal was supposed to be available until August 31, 2025. However, it has now been extended, and players have an additional two months to claim the First Order Stormtrooper skin.

To get the First Order Stormtrooper skin in Fortnite , players must create a MyDisney account and then link it to their Epic Games account. If players are having trouble completing this process, they can check out our complete guide on how to claim the First Order Stormtrooper in Fortnite . The offer will remain available until October 31, 2025, giving players plenty of time to add this skin to their in-game lockers.

Currently, there are nine free skins available in Fortnite . However, most of them are part of limited-time offers, and once they expire, they will only be available via the Item Shop. Fortnite gives players plenty of opportunities to acquire free cosmetics, especially for those who enjoy the competitive scene. Every day, there are various tournaments that gamers can view and enter by visiting the Compete tab in-game. Many of these competitions include free cosmetics, and those who are able to be among the top players in their region can even get skins before they hit the Item Shop.

Create, play, and battle with friends for free in Fortnite. Be the last player standing in Battle Royale and Zero Build, experience a concert or live event, or discover over a million creator made games, including racing, parkour, zombie survival, and more. Each Fortnite island has an individual age rating so you can find the one that's right for you and your friends.

Explore large, destructible environments where no two games are ever the same. Team up with friends by sprinting, climbing and smashing your way to earn your Victory Royale, whether you choose to build up in Fortnite Battle Royale or go no-builds in Fortnite Zero Build.

Discover even more ways to play across thousands of creator-made game genres: adventure, roleplay, survival and more. Or, band together with up to three friends to fend off hordes of monsters in Save the World.

item.title: Magic: the Gathering Details New Mechanics in Spider-Man Set
item.description:
Magic: the Gathering is sharing all the details about the new mechanics being utilized within its upcoming Spider-Man set, including both new and returning mechanics. The newest partnership between Wizards of the Coast and Marvel has given fans plenty of reason to be excited, with a variety of unique and powerful cards. Magic: the Gathering 's upcoming Spider-Man set features Spider-Man and several of his most iconic foes from throughout the franchise's history, including Doc Ock, Green Goblin, and Mysterio among others. Now, Wizards of the Coast is giving a sneak preview of some of the new mechanics.

The initial reveals for Magic 's Spider-Man set have teased a variety of exciting cards coming with the set's release. Multiple different multiverse versions of Spider-Man will be receiving their own cards, ranging from Peter Parker and Miles Morales to Gwen Stacy and even a card based on Spider-Ham. Many of the cards also have unique thematic effects tied to their character, like "Doc Ock, Sinister Scientist" becoming an 8/8 creature when the player has eight or more cards in their graveyard. Some of Spider-Man 's brand-new mechanics are now being showcased by Wizards of the Coast.

A new post from Wizards of the Coast is now showing off some of the Spider-Man expansion's new mechanics coming to the game. Magic 's Spider-Man set will introduce a new "Web-Slinging" mechanic, allowing players to play cards for an alternative cost by also returning a tapped creature to their hand. "Mayhem" allows players to cast a card from their graveyard if they discarded it from their hand during the turn while the new "The Soul Stone" card introduces the "Harness" ability, permanently unlocking an ability by paying its initial cost. Spider-Man is also bringing back some older Magic mechanics, including "Connive," double-sided cards, and "Modified creatures."

Magic: the Gathering Details New Spider-Man Mechanics

  • Web-Slinging : You may cast cards with Web-Slinging for an alternative cost if you also return a tapped creature you control to its owner's hand.
  • Mayhem : You may cast cards with Mayhem from your graveyard for an alternative cost if you discarded it during the same turn. Timing rules still apply.
  • Connive : Draw a card, then discard a card. If you discard a nonland card, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
  • Double-Sided Cards with Transform : Double-sided cards with Transform can be played on either side, with one side having an ability to transform into the other side.
  • Modified Creatures : Equipment, Auras you control, and counters are modifications.

The plethora of new mechanics in the Spider-Man set look to see a wide variety of uses across the set's different cards. Many of the Spider-Man variants in the set utilize Web-Slinging, allowing players to quickly play more powerful creatures by swinging into action. The introduction of The Soul Stone also heavily implies future cards based on the Infinity Stones, with more Marvel expansions confirmed to be coming in 2026. Magic: the Gathering 's Spider-Man set will officially release on September 26.

The Spider-Man expansion is not the only new expansion coming to Magic: the Gathering throughout the rest of the year. 2025 will see one more major set release in the Fall, with November bringing another "Universes Beyond" set adding cards based on Avatar: The Last Airbender . Wizards of the Coast has also already teased multiple in-universe sets coming in 2026, revealing "Lorwyn Eclipsed" and "Secrets of Strixhaven" to launch sometime next year. Magic: the Gathering 's first full Marvel crossover set looks to have lots of exciting and powerful cards coming soon.
